_header: The joy of our heart is wither to woe
Note: For very similar lines see 384, 5216, 5349 and 5351.
Subjects: laments, sinners’; scripture texts, Engl. trans. of

OxfMert120.Transcription:
þe ioye of vr hert es withen to woþe floures of vr gerland
                    arne fallen thar froþe game of vr carollyng es turned to sorowewo
                    es vs for synne may no man vs b[ ]
OxfMert120.Editions:
Coxe,  Henry Octavius. 
             Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque
                oxoniensibus….
         Oxon: e Typographeo academico, 1852: 55.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.146.
